text: Beta statistic fits beta splitting model node, assuming number extant descendents daughter branch split following beta distribution, number extant descendentants x y node follows \(q(x, y) = s_n(beta)^-1 \frac{(gamma(x + 1 + beta)gamma(y + 1 + beta))}{gamma(x+1)gamma(y+1)}\), \(s_n(beta)^-1\) normalizing constant. model fit tree, different values beta correspond expectation following different diversification models, beta 0 corresponds Yule tree, beta -3/2 tree following PDA model. general, negative beta values correspond trees unbalanced Yule trees, beta values larger zero indicate trees balanced Yule trees. lower bound beta splitting parameter -2.

Lastly, treestats package also includes   faster, C++ based, implementation ape::branching.times (  function branching_times), yields sequence branching times,   omits branching names favour speed.
